Transportation would come to a standstill as most vehicles run on oil, leading to a complete breakdown of the transportation system. This would make it difficult for people to travel, transport goods, and access essential services.

The global economy would be severely impacted as many industries rely on oil for their operations, such as manufacturing, construction, and mining. This would lead to a decrease in production and economic growth.
The availability of food would also be affected as oil is used in the production and transportation of food, leading to shortages and increased prices.
The environment would be severely impacted as oil production and transportation contribute to greenhouse gas emissions, leading to climate change.
The military would also be impacted as oil is used in the production and transportation of military equipment and vehicles, leading to a decrease in military capabilities.
